column4: Alright, when I partition the disks while installing from the alternate cd, which option is best if I have a 9GB hd and a 3.2 Gb hd, which previously had Windows XP installed and now have files from failed attempts to install ubuntu?
maybe put / & swap on the 3gig, and the rest on the 9gig /usr, /var, /home
I would have to choose the manual option to do that, right?
you can have 3 primary partions + 1 extended partition/in the extended partition, you can have more logical paritions
thanks. So I start with a primary partition. I guess that makes sense.
do I go to where it says, "Label for the file system in this partition" type /usr and continue?
yep, and specify mount point as /usr & file system as ext3
labels are only for your ref - whatever you like
does it make sense to set a partition up with 9.1 GB of space for the root file system?
I said put / & swap on the 3gig
they should both be primary partitions, right?
I set the mount point to / on one partition and swap on the other?
